As a correction the operations Administrator advised that the staff member who used profane language around a youth will be required to take refresher training on staff/student interactions and boundaries.

Deficiency Narrative: One employee was observed to be delinquent in completing two annual trainings.
Correction Narrative: GCTC uses a training database to track training due.  The training courses in the database have been set to show required training due every 11 months.  This will ensure training is completed within the established timeframes.

Deficiency Narrative: Caregiver was not awake during sleeping hours.
Correction Narrative: Gulf Coast Trades Center supervisors visit each dorm on campus once per hour.  They check in with an electronic devise that is monitored to ensure that these dorm visits are taking place.  This ensures that staff are monitored and given a break, if needed.  GCTC will continue this practice.

Deficiency Narrative: The allegations are related to a DFPS abuse/neglect investigation.
Correction Narrative: Standard was found to be in compliance during follow-up inspection.

Deficiency Narrative: Investigators reported being recorded while interviewing children and staff at the facility.
Correction Narrative: Standard was found to be in compliance during follow-up inspection.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member reported that a previous staff member forced children to drink water out of the bathroom faucet and shower.
Correction Narrative: Standard was found to be in compliance during follow-up inspection.

Deficiency Narrative: Children in care reported not being allowed to call complaints into the ombudsman office without first contacting administrative staff.
Correction Narrative: Gulf Coast Trades Center will ensure all staff are aware of the protocols in place when youth request to make a hotline call.  Specifically, staff are to find a private area, dial the hotline number, step away from the area and allow the youth to speak to the hotline personnel.  GCTC currently has this practice in place and will continue with this practice.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the four employee files reviewed was observed to not have drug test results. This employee was on shift as recent at 02/22/24 supervising children in care.
Correction Narrative: HR will ensure that every newly hired employee has a negative drug test result prior to allowing the employee to supervise youth alone.  In this incident the employee had to be retested.  Results were received on 02/25/2025.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member flipped the residents' bed and took their personal belongings out of anger.
Correction Narrative: Inspector conducted a follow-up visit and interviewed two children in care, neither of which made any further outcries of abuse/neglect. The operation emailed the following corrective action on 04/02/25: Expectations of direct care staff will be discussed during their shift meetings to include behaviors.  Staff will need to be relieved from their duty post, if needed, to walk away from the situation.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member forced a child to do sit-up and plank for breaking into his mother's vehicle.
Correction Narrative: Inspector conducted a follow-up visit and interviewed two children in care, neither of which made any further outcries of abuse/neglect. The operation emailed the following corrective action on 04/02/25: The minimum standard will be sent out to all direct care supervisors to go over with their staff.  This will be documented that every direct care staff has been trained on corporal punishment.

Deficiency Narrative: Family visits at the operation were suspended due to suspected illegal substances being brought in during the visits.
Correction Narrative:
Inspector conducted a follow-up visit and interviewed two children in care, neither of which made any further outcries of abuse/neglect. The operation emailed the following corrective action on 04/02/25: Students have and will continue to be allowed to make weekly phone calls to family on their approved visitation list.  In addition, when visitation is suspended zoom visits are made available and will continue to be made available.  Moving forward, if in person visitation has to be suspended, we will continue with our weekly phone calls and zoom visits.

AR will be requested.

Deficiency Narrative: Records reviewed show a suicide screening was not completed timely for a youth in care.
Correction Narrative: On October 25, 2024; refresher training was conducted to all direct care staff on Suicide Protocols.  Training included steps to be taken when a youth voices thoughts of suicide or attempts suicide.  In addition, all direct care supervisors were added to an email mailing list that notifies on-duty management of the on-call clinician for weekends.

An on-call process for mental health concerns and emergencies has been created to include local GCTC therapists along with a backup corporate on-call therapist on the weekends. Attachments on the email include Sign in sheet from 2/18/22 meeting, revised Incident Report, and the Mental Health On-Call Process Flow. 
4/11/22: At April Probation Inspection, incident reports were reviewed in compliance of their new reporting/follow up process.

GCTC takes pride in providing excellent services and safety to the youth in our care and appreciate your diligence in assisting us to obtain excellence.

Deficiency Narrative: Per staff rosters, the operation was out of ratio 5 days in the past 3 weeks of operation.
Correction Narrative: GCTC is actively pursuing applicants for Group Worker positions.  Due to COVID-19, we are unable to attend job fairs.  However, we coordinate with local workforce offices to assist with advertising, as well as, use social media and offer referral awards to staff.  The HR and Residential Directors attended a local event (Discover Local) on November 10, 2020 in hopes of attracting applicants.  For the past 30 days HR has received 19 applications.  Of those 1 declined the position, 3 were deemed not qualified, 1 did not clear the CRC, 1 did not show for the interview and we are waiting on CRC clearances for 2.  Three applicants were offered employment and failed to show for fingerprinting and drug testing.  Three additional applicants were interviewed on 12/07 and 12/08 and are in the pre-employment process.  We have 2 interviews pending and 3 have been contacted for interviews and we are waiting on responses from applicants.  We will continue to actively market and recruit applicants.

Deficiency Narrative: Gym equipment had holes torn in them, which were attempted to be fixed with easily removable staples.
Correction Narrative: Photos of the gym equipment were sent and observed in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: One child's Incident Report and face to face interview revealed that he expressed not being able to make phone calls to Licensing.
Correction Narrative: All staff have been made aware of youth basic rights to include the ability to make phone calls to licensing and ombudsman.  Sign-in sheets were completed upon conclusion of training.

Deficiency Narrative: Serious incident reports missing child's age, gender, and date of admission.
Correction Narrative: The form will be revised to include this information.

Deficiency Narrative: There is a hole in the brick wall of the gym.
Correction Narrative: Exercise equipment was once hung on the brick wall and was removed.  The holes that resulted were filled with mortar and a student dug out the mortar within the last day or two. Photos were provided.

Deficiency Narrative: One of eight reviewed initial service plans is not congruent with needs listed in the  child's preliminary service plan.
Correction Narrative: Initial Service Plans will be written to address student needs identified in the PSP.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found that a staff member did not intervene during a fight, resulting in a child sustaining an injury.
Correction Narrative: If an incident of this nature were to occur on our facility, the staff would be removed from the direct care position. They may be placed in a position that does not require them to supervise children or they could face separation from employment.  If the situation warrants a safety plan, one will be developed for the staff and the referring agency will be notified.

Deficiency Narrative: It was found that a staff neglected to appropriately supervise children in care, resulting in a child being physically harmed by two other children, on two different occasions.
Correction Narrative: As per the Administrator and Residential Director, the staff related to this incident is no longer DCS, he is kitchen staff and does not have direct access to children in care. GCTC is abiding by conditions set forth by Probation which includes weekly assessments of behavioral and supervision needs of children in care, and compliance of staff completing job duties.

Deficiency Narrative: 6 out of the 10 staff members interviewed stated due to covid-19, they were too short of staff to stay in ratio and there were staffing problems. 4 of the 5 residents interviewed stated there is an issue with being in ratio amongst the staff and due to being short staff, they were not able to catch some of the bullying that was going on.
Correction Narrative:
Per the operation, Gulf Coast Trades Center did go through a period where we were unable to fill Group Worker positions.  Challenges were faced in getting applicants fingerprinted and drug tested due to locations being closed or operating at reduced hours.  At this time we have 5 applicants in New Hire Orientation and 3 additional applicants in the background process.

On 1/20/21, a follow up inspection was completed where the operation was observed in compliance due to their contract with DFPS being closed and several children being discharged.

Deficiency Narrative: During the investigation children from several dorms were outside running around, three children AWOL, several of children were in the pool without prior supervision, a group of children physically attack one resident.
Correction Narrative:
Per the Administrator, Gulf Coast is always trying to develop new ways of dealing with youth and their behaviors as they arise. In this particular case as stated I feel that our staff and administrators responded appropriately.  We as an agency are constantly tracking trends and developing methods to address these trends.

Deficiency Narrative: Concerns regarding inappropriate staff/resident relationships was not reported to licensing.
Correction Narrative: Gulf Coast Trades Center has requested an administrative review.
